title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 24 February 2016 - XWiki

00:04 <abusenius> has quit  
00:12 \* daemoen wonders why the xikibot targets all users in the channel  
00:13 <daemoen> sdumitriu: who runs the xwiki bot ?  
00:35 <Pbas> has quit  
00:37 <Pbas> has joined #xwiki  
00:48 <sdumitriu> daemoen: It's running inside xwiki.org itself  
00:49 <sdumitriu> After a network split, when the two parts reconnect, the bot hits a glitch when it receives too many "joined" messages  
00:51 <daemoen> interesting;  i was actually going to make a suggestion;  have 2 rooms -- xwiki,  xwiki-devel;  have the bot log and interact in -devel as a secondary room the developers can be in, and keep the primary channel 'clean' for community interactions (normal for most open source projects)  
00:51 <daemoen> but as im new to the room, dont know how that would affect things, or if it would be something others would be interested in seeing in general  
01:02 <sdumitriu> I think that's a good suggestion, but I'm not the right person to handle that, since I'm no longer involved as much in XWiki

08:29 <acotiuga> has joined #xwiki  
08:50 <acotiuga> Hello!  
08:50 <acotiuga> I have an integration-tests issue on Meeting Application (which uses the Mail Sender API). The test is failing due the incompatibility of the parameter's type used in the $services.mailsender.send() method with the needed one (javax.mail.internet.MimeMessage).  
08:50 <acotiuga> In XE 7.4.1 the $services.mailsender.createMessage() method returns an object of org.xwiki.mail.script.ScriptMimeMessage class (available  since 7.1M2) which extends org.xwiki.mail.internal.ExtendedMimeMessage which extends javax.mail.internet.MimeMessage, so it's the proper parameter type and it works being used in the .send() method.  
08:51 <acotiuga> In XE 6.2 the $services.mailsender.createMessage() method returns a org.xwiki.mail.script.MimeMessageWrapper which extends directly javax.mail.internet.MimeMessage but it doens't work being used as parameter in the .send() method.  
08:51 <acotiuga> My questions are:  
08:51 <acotiuga> Why org.xwiki.mail.script.MimeMessageWrapper can't be used as paramether in .send()?  
08:51 <acotiuga> Should the org.xwiki.commons version be upgraded in the application's pom to 7.1 in order to have org.xwiki.mail.script.ScriptMimeMessage?  
08:52 <acotiuga> What other possible options to fix this issue do I have ?
